reviewText: ...this is EMPHATICALLY NOT the best Depeche Mode DVD. The film quality is top notch. The stage set is great thanks once again to Anton Corbin although this is decidedly NOT the best set they have had. My biggest problem with this DVD is watching this vital band falling into the "Rolling Stones Syndrome". You only get to see a young band while they are young, and once they have reached a certain age; i.e. looking older, moving slower, a bit winded... they really should adjust their presentation. It is sad when Fletch comes off looking the best in the group. Unfortunately Depeche Mode has followed the Rolling Stones playbook play for play. Now maybe that is not so important from your seats a way back at the arena but it does NOT play well with close-ups on HDTV. Watch ANY of their previously released concert DVDs and ask yourself..."Has this band become a parody of themselves?". You may not think so and that is fine. I say they have and it is past time for them to adjust their presentation so as not to distract from the fantastic music they have created. I am keeping my 101, Devotional and Exciter concert DVDs. I have just listed Touring the Angel on E-bay.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Depeche Mode along with only few bands managed to stay both musically relevant and at the same time still make big sales from 80's, through 90's and 00's to these days, never repeating themselves, never going backwards, always expanding creatively.From the beginning, and along the way, they didn't follow anyone; they created their own musical forms. Much of what is modern day electronic music owes its roots to Depeche Mode and their effect on the new wave. It's not strange lot of today's bands admit Depeche Mode is or were their model.After 25 years of touring, Depeche Mode put on one of the best shows of their careers in Touring the Angel, in support of their multiple platinum album Playing the Angel, released late in 2005.This 3-disc digipak set features two DVD's and an audio CD. There are lots of extras on disc two, but as always maybe not enough to satisfy biggest fans. Included documentary takes a real close look at not just the making of the album and the stage sets for the live show, but a look at the separate members of the band - Andy Fletcher, Martin Gore and, Dave Gahan. We get a close and personal introspective on their thoughts as they put together the album and the show, how it sparked their careers.The concert is, visually and aurally, just incredible. I saw them in Zagreb, Vienna, Ljubljana and several other places, but this one is one of their best concerts - more vibrant, more energy, and the feast for the eyes.  Their design crews, construction, whole atmosphere, deserve a lot of credit.Much of the impact is a result of the polished presentation of the DVD itself. Every camera angle is just what it should be. Every shot gives you what you need; it pushes the music but doesn't overwhelm it. As great as it would have been to be at this show, the digital image is a pretty good substitute and I'd say you actually get a better view. Obviously, nothing can replace the raw experience of being there - the crowd, the excitement and the energy.Disc one includes all the tracks from the live show, including almost everything from Playing the Angel album plus earlier and everlasting hits as 'Behind the Wheel', 'Personal Jesus', 'I Feel You', 'Never Let Me Down Again', and many others.Disc two boasts a good quantity of extras such as the Touring the Angel documentary, Playing the Angel Electronic Press Kit, the official Depeche Mode Touring the Angel tour announcement from Germany, Touring the Angel screens, which enables you to watch just the stuff going on in the background on the large screens during select songs, subtitles and credits.The standout feature is the documentary. We get honest and straightforward interviews with DM  greats - Martin Gore, Dave Gahan, Andy "Fletch" Fletcher, the director Blue Leach, Anton Corbjin, Depeche Mode pianist Peter Gordeno, and Daniel Miller of Mute Records, among many others. We get to see backstage shots of the set, the director and producer talk about the crazy use of cameras during the tour, and many, many others.The audio CD features over 30 minutes of audio directly from the show, including tracks such as 'The Sinner in Me', 'Damaged People', 'Precious', and 'John the Revelator.If you have some kind of idea stuck in your head the Mode is outdated or  old, you need to rethink it. Because to me, and I've been a big fan for almost 25 years, they look sharper than ever. And the new songs are getting better with each album.As I mentioned, of what an ungodly amount of beautiful and original songs that you know by heart, they keep belting out one after the other. And the timeless quality of their music, it could from 80's to these days, but it all blends into the Depeche Mode. It's an inspiring thing because these guys really seem like they care about putting on a show, about touching people, at least for that few hours they're in the same stadium together. That's something you just can't put a price on, which is why they continue to pack arenas wherever they go.For those who attended the shows, this DVD is a must have, and for the unfortunate DM fans who didn't get to see the show, this is closest to the real thing.
summary: Must have, closest to the real thing...
Title: N/A

reviewText: Both the Audio and Video quality of this DVD is very good. I saw this tour twice (once at The Joint @ The Hardrock Hotel Las Vegas and the second time in the parking lot of the Hardrock a few months later). This DVD brings the concert back home and even allowed me to see certain visuals unseen live.As for whether or not to get this or the 3 disc version... my thoughts are as follows: Both editions have the 122 minute concert in it's entirety. I don't need a behind the scenes documentary and the CD that comes with the other edition is a waste of time and money. I simply ripped the entire concert into AIFF format and converted to mp3 for use on my iPod. Why have a CD with 7 songs when you can make your own live soundtrack with them all.
summary: Great DVD of an Awesome Concert

reviewText: A todos los fans de DPM, no compren este DVD, hagan una búsqueda de DPM como Music y compren Touring The Angel Live In Milan como CD, este tiene 3 discos:Disco 1: El Concierto(DVD)Disco 2: Documental(DVD)Disco 3: 8 canciones en vivo(CD)Cuesta un poco mas, pero realmente vale la pena

reviewText: Depeche mode have been consistently putting out great live dvds of their tours and this one pretty much beats them all so far! If you get the deluxe version not only will you get the concert dvd but also a live cd of all the songs from Playing the angel album and a bonus dvd of behind the scenes footage interviews etc....if you're a fan then this must be added to your collection!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is one of the best concert videos I have ever seen.  My sister saw the show in San Antonio and she raved about the whole show....so since I could not make it to one myself, this is the next best thing.They also perform a lot of early songs and the entire set list does not disappoint.  The outfit worn by Gore is awesome and Dave is as good as ever.  I cannot say it enough, if you like or love Depeche Mode...this is a must buy!!!!
summary: Only bad thing is that I did not see them in person.....
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is by far the most enjoyable dvd by DM. Yes i am sure that Devotional DVD and Exciter DVD were great but in terms of denstiy and powerful, it seems that this dvd is better, Anton is great for making music video but i don't think he is good for live performance as the camera angels in Devotional DVD and Exciter DVD looked plain and focus too much on the screens and stage (which he designed). Yes, i agreed with other reviewers that there're a bit too much of effect on thisdvd but that's the way of making live dvd nowadays.However, i have to admit that the performace of 'Personal jesus','Enjoy the silence' and 'Never let me down again' these 3 all times in set list in this dvd aren't better than the versions in Exciter dvd which more enjoyable.Great tracks : A question of time,Policy of truth,Behind the wheel,World in my eye and Walking in my shoesHighlight : Just can't get enough and Everything counts (Remind me how great these old synth pop songs can be grown and sound so much fresh after 25 years).
summary: The best DM live dvd by far
Title: N/A

reviewText: This DVD includes only the live concert. Get the other 3 disc edition instead which includes the same live concert, plus a behind the scenes documentary and other extras PLUS a live audio CD of 7 of the live songs!They (the record company) really blew it by not including the extras with this DVD. Instead, they hadto release 2 different packages, this one and the other edition which costs more. That said, this one is a total waste of money and if you are a Depeche Mode fan at all, you would do well to get the special edition instead. Unless you don't want the extras.
summary: Get the other 3 disc edition instead
Title: N/A

reviewText: In the years since becoming a SoCal Depeche Mode fan (late 1980's),they have played to a sold out Rose Bowl crowd (1987),they have played multiple Dodger Stadium shows (1990),they have played five shows at the Great Western Forum (1993),and they have played multiple shows at both the Staples Center and Arrowhead Pond (1998,2001,2005). The same three band members who continue to arouse fans in this year of 2006 are the same three individuals who were doing it back in its beginnings in 1980. And unlike most bands who have been around for roughly 20+ years who continue to tour the county fair circuit with nothing new to promote and with less than half of its original members,Depeche Mode are still out there with its original members touring in support of new material that still gets its share of air time on the radio. Amazingly,after all that Depeche Mode has done for music,critics out there don't seem to want to rank Depeche Mode among the great ones such as Elvis,The Beatles,The Stones,Zeppelin,or even U2,a band from the same era as DM. In TOURING THE ANGEL:LIVE IN MILAN,Depeche Mode enters a quarter of a century of music embarking on the tour supporting the PLAYING THE ANGEL album,their 12th one of new material. Unlike the not-so-exciting EXCITER tour,the setlist on this dvd contains more 1980's hits not heard in several tours (just can't get enough,behind the wheel,shake the disease,question of lust,everything counts.....). It was the first tour since the Violater tour not to feature back-up singers (THANK GOD!!!!) and was the tour that Dave Gahan said was one of the most enjoyable! I have gone to exactly 106 concerts as of November of 2006 and only The Stones and Depeche Mode have I seen five or more times each. With all the fun this band had,I believe there will one day be another DM album and tour. Say what you want but Depeche Mode are legends who are sadly far too underrated. 2006 marks the 25th anniversary of their debut release,"Speak and Spell",making DM eligible for the Rock N Roll Hall of Fame. Unfortunately,with all the negative criticism the RnR HoF committee receives every year for leaving out some of the biggest names in music,don't be surprise if once again they foul up by not considering a quality band like Depeche Mode. In the meantime while you are waiting for their induction,next album or next tour,pickup TOURING THE ANGEL:LIVE IN MILAN and add it to your collection of DM DVDs (101,Devotional,Live in Paris....). If Devotional was the tour that made DM legends,then Touring the Angel is the tour that makes DM untouchable. "Just can't get enough"!
summary: The tour that proves DM is "UNTOUCHABLE"
